Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior, from top: black-figure decoration consisting of uncertain motif, perhaps rump of sphinx seated to right; band of dots between narrow brown bands; lion (part of mane with added red and back remaining) to right, with incised pendant rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos places this sherd in Group A of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The decoration on the vases from this group is the most elaborate. The rosette has a standard cogwheel shape and the figures are carefully drawn and details are expertly incised.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 14, no. 21, pl. 3)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 147, p. 315, no. 1356, pl. 175)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2097) (phase 2)
